title: Glib build failure when AutotoolsPackage does not load m4
body:
``` bash
$ spack install glib
==> Installing glib
==> Applied patch no-Werror=format-security.patch
==> Ran patch() for glib
==> Building glib [AutotoolsPackage]
==> Executing phase : 'autoreconf'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_systems/autotools.py:229, in autoreconf:
     198      def autoreconf(self, spec, prefix):
     199          """Not needed usually, configure should be already there"""
     200          # If configure exists nothing needs to be done
     201          if os.path.exists(self.configure_abs_path):
     202              return
     203          # Else try to regenerate it
     204          autotools = ['m4', 'autoconf', 'automake', 'libtool']
     205          missing = [x for x in autotools if x not in spec]
     206          if missing:
     207              msg = 'Cannot generate configure: missing dependencies {0}'
     208              raise RuntimeError(msg.format(missing))
     209          tty.msg('Configure script not found: trying to generate it')
     210          tty.warn('*********************************************************')
     211          tty.warn('* If the default procedure fails, consider implementing *')
     212          tty.warn('*        a custom AUTORECONF phase in the package       *')
     213          tty.warn('*********************************************************')
     214          with working_dir(self.configure_directory):
     215              m = inspect.getmodule(self)
     216              # This part should be redundant in principle, but
     217              # won't hurt
     218              m.libtoolize()
     219              m.aclocal()
     220              # This line is what is needed most of the time
     221              # --install, --verbose, --force
     222              autoreconf_args = ['-ivf']
     223              if 'pkg-config' in spec:
     224                  autoreconf_args += [
     225                      '-I',
     226                      join_path(spec['pkg-config'].prefix, 'share', 'aclocal'),
     227                  ]
     228              autoreconf_args += self.autoreconf_extra_args
  >> 229              m.autoreconf(*autoreconf_args)
```

From the build log

```
==> Configure script not found: trying to generate it
==> Warning: *********************************************************
==> Warning: * If the default procedure fails, consider implementing *
==> Warning: *        a custom AUTORECONF phase in the package       *
==> Warning: *********************************************************
==> 'libtool-2.4.6-bcbiddkmbu4gy7wx6ftntmxqe3c5br3z/bin/libtoolize'
libtoolize:   error: One of these is required:
libtoolize:                 gm4 gnum4 m4
libtoolize:   error: Please install GNU M4, or 'export M4=/path/to/gnu/m4'.
```

Which is solved when m4 is added as a dependency

``` python
depends_on('m4', type='build')
```

My deeper question is whether this dependency belongs in the package like the solution above, or if AutotoolsPackage should find this automatically.
